title: Shrine of Al-Hussien closed for Ashoura commemorations: Ministry
text:
The shrine of Al-Hussien will be closed down by the ministry of awqaf (religious endowments) fromThursday to Saturday during the religious Ashoura celebrations, state-owned news agency MENA reported.
The reason behind the closure is to prevent "shiaa lies" that take place during the celebrations and "shiaa rituals that don’t belong to Islam", an official statement by the ministry read.
The ministry added that it will take necessary legal procedures against any violators of its decision.
The Ministry of Awqaf controls mosques in Egypt according to Sunni doctrines and does not recognise Shia mosques or rituals.
Ashoura, the 10th day of the Islamic calendar, is a festival for the general Muslim community who celebrate it for a number of religious events that, although unrelated, coincided on the same day.
Over the years, Salafist groups – whose doctrine prohibits the sanctification of persons and shrines – have warned they would not allow any Shia commemorations at Al-Hussein Mosque.
Shia Muslims, however, commemorate on Ashoura the martyrdom of Prophet Mohamed's grandson, Imam Al-Hussein, whose decapitated head is believed to be buried at Old Cairo's Al-Hussein Mosque.
This is not the first time Egypt has closed down the shrine ahead of the Islamic Ashoura festival.
In November 2013, the ministry closed the shrine at the heart of Al-Hussein Mosque to visitors to avert possible clashes between Salafists and Shias during the Ashoura commemorations.
